dict.string:
This patch renders a 3D particle system.
Each particle is created at position specified by the X/Y/Z position inputs, with a color specified by the "Color" input and a lifetime defined by the "Lifetime" input. The initial velocity of the particle is randomly chosen in the range specified by the X/Y/Z Min/Max velocity inputs. Its initial size is randomly chosen in the range specified by the Min/Max size inputs.
The particle movement is then affected by gravity and by the attraction relative to its initial position, its size is reduced by "Size Delta" per second and its opacity is also reduced by "Opacity Delta" per second. When the particle reaches its lifetime, it is regenerated.
The particles can display an image specified by the "Image" input but it will be the same for all particles, independently of their individual states.
Note that this particle system will not be deterministic unless all its input parameters are constants.
The initial position of the particles on the X-axis.

The minimum initial velocity of the particles on the Z-axis.
The maximum initial velocity of the particles on the Z-axis.
The minimum initial size of the particles.
The maximum initial size of the particles.
The initial color of the particles.
The amount of attraction influencing the particle movement.
The particle size change in units per second.
